event_details.name: Greengrass
event_details.description: The start of spring is traditionally a day of peace and rejoicing marked by the display of flowers (even if they need to be grown in a hothouse during the winter months, or brought from southern climes) that are worn or given as sacrifices to the gods who have brought life back to the world. A group of Githyanki have other plans for the day, though.

details.freeplay_cost_desc: Free Play costs between 500 and 2500 Bouquets to start

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Nrakk Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Nrakk (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: Ki Master
upgrades_to_display.description: Nrakk uses Ki Points to power up his attacks and abilities. He gains them when he attacks and expells them to deal more damage and stun his enemies.

upgrades_to_display.name: Githzerai Focus
upgrades_to_display.description: Nrakk increases the potency of the Formation Abilities of adjacent Champions.

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Aila Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Aila (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: Storm Aura
upgrades_to_display.description: Aila periodically strikes a random enemy with lightning, Priming them and making them take extra damage from all Champions.

upgrades_to_display.name: Storm Soul
upgrades_to_display.description: Primed enemies that Aila attacks become Electrified, stunning them and further increasing the extra damage thye take from all Champions.

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Melf Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Melf (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: Melf's Adaptive Support Spell
upgrades_to_display.description: Melf creates a custom spell that buffs the formation partially based on who is in it.

upgrades_to_display.name: Melf's Speedy Supplement
upgrades_to_display.description: Melf provides speed boosts to help you power through areas faster than ever!

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Orkira Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Orkira (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: Elemental Fire
upgrades_to_display.description: Orkira leaves a debuff and a DoT on all enemies that she damages. The debuff can be increased based on the amount of healing that Orkira has provided.

years.shop_desc: Each Gold Gazrick Chest contains five cards, two of which are guaranteed to be gear for Gazrick (at least one of which will be rare or better)

upgrades_to_display.name: Frosty Friendship
upgrades_to_display.description: Gazrick buffs Champions in a unique snowflake formation

upgrades_to_display.name: Armor Ablation
upgrades_to_display.description: Gazrick attacks reduce the amount of damage required to destroy a section of enemy armor

adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "The Endless War (Orkira)" Costs up to 2500 Bouquets to start

adventure_defines.restrictions_text:
Gazrick starts in the formation. He can't be moved or removed from the formation.
Two Ice Mephits have befriended Gazrick. It's not weird.
Getting to know Gazrick: Gazrick's main support ability gets stronger with distance in a straight line. Place your damage dealers to get the most out of Gazrick's buffs!

adventure_defines.name: Brain Freeze
adventure_defines.description: Defend Triboar from a Githyanki invasion during a strange cold front.
adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "The Endless War (Gazrick)" Costs 2500 Bouquets to start
adventure_defines.restrictions_text:
Gazrick starts in the formation. He can't be moved or removed from the formation.
Gazrick has created three Snow Golems companions. Each Golem has an intellect devourer perched on their head. It's not weird.
Only Champions with an INT score of 13 or higher can be used.
It's snowing in all areas where there is not already weather set.
Getting to know Gazrick: Gazrick's main support ability can still support through gaps in the formation. Place your damage dealers to get the most out of Gazrick's buffs!

adventure_defines.name: Armored Assault
adventure_defines.description: Defend Triboar from a Githyanki invasion and extra armored bosses.
adventure_defines.requirements_text: Must have completed "The Endless War (Gazrick)" Costs 5000 Bouquets to start
adventure_defines.restrictions_text:
Gazrick starts in the formation. He can be moved, but he can't be removed. His Armor Ablation ability starts unlocked.
All boss enemies have at least 25 armored health.
Armored enemies require 100% more damage to deal one armored hit.
Gazrick's Armor Ablation ability is +100% more effective.
Getting to Know Gazrick: Gazrick's attacks can weaken armor. Use his specialization and increase his attack speed to make the most of this feature!

campaign_defines.name: A Grand Tour of the Sword Coast
campaign_defines.description: Your introduction to the Sword Coast and beyond.

quest_defines.description: Thin out the cursed cows so you can search the area.
Even the rats have gone mad. Gather some cursed tails for your trophy case.
Vultures have begun to appear -- feeding on the dead cows and rats. Hopefully the curse can't be spread by carrion eaters.
You hear a crash from the direction of the farmhouse. Head back there to see what caused it.
With a loud whinny, a ferocious horse rounds the house and attacks.
Search the area for anything related to the warhorse.
Head towards the barn. You haven't checked that out yet.
A large number of vultures and rats have converged around some poor goat corpses. Scare them off.
There's noise coming from inside the barn. Prepare yourself!
A farmhand cowers in the corner as you enter. He looks like he hasn't eaten in a week. Without warning, he attacks!
Make your way through the secret tunnel.
You notice a glint in the dirt. Treasure?
A table here seems to contain many rich relics. Just who was this farmer?
The cavern gets lighter ahead, though the enemies seem as thick as ever.
With a hoot and a groan, an enormous owlbear leaps from the shadows.
This dungeon must have been below the farm the whole time. Gnolls appear to have recently moved in.
Search for some sign of who built this dungeon, or how long it has been here.
Clear out some more gnolls so you can get a better feel for the place.
There aren't many relics on this level. It seems like it has been picked clean. Try to find any the previous looters missed.
The gnolls' leader has appeared. He isn't very happy that you're messing up his pack's new home.
The remaining gnolls seem to be vehemently defending this corridor. Perhaps something of value still remains.
It's a treasure room! Collect some swag!
Ugh. It's been almost completely cleared out. There are a few locked treasure chests still unopened. See if you can find the keys.
These gnolls are covered in a sizzling translucent jelly! You've got a bad feeling about this.
A section of the room that was deep in the shadows suddenly jiggles, then lurches towards you.
This part of the dungeon seems to have been completely cleared out, but something tells you there's more to be found.
This room may have been a library once, but it's been stripped completely bare. See if you can find anything the looters missed.
Search for the stairs leading down to the lower level.
Follow the right-hand rule!
As the stairs descend into darkness, you hear a heavy skittering from below.
This part of the dungeon seems much more well kept, as if someone has recently lived here.
You stumble into an entirely intact treasure room in the process of being looted by goblins.
Gather some of those jeweled goblets.
Wait a minute... that treasure chest just moved! Look out!
From underneath a pile of discarded treasure, a massive mimic appears and begins chomping its way towards you.
You are amazed at how clean and well kept this section of the dungeon is. Rats and spiders aside, there must be someone down here keeping this place so tidy.
Someone has converted this part of the hallway into somewhat of a shrine.
You almost stumble into a bed chamber that looks as if it were made up this morning. What's more, it's crawling with imps.
There's a pile of well-read books next to the bed. See if there's anything interesting.
A tapestry on the wall shifts, and from behind it comes an imp more terrifying than any of the others.
Behind the tapestry you find a hidden tunnel.
You exit the tunnel into a large chamber. Ritual candles adorn the floor like a carpet, and strange symbols are painted upon the walls and ceiling.
A strange bubbling cauldron sits in the middle of the room.
Gather materials to attempt to neutralize the poison.
Just as you're about to toss in the antidote, a finely dressed cleric emerges from the tunnel that you entered through.
The cauldron explodes in a flash of light and a rift appears where it once stood.
You're going to need more materials. Gather some paint.
The otherworldly horde pouring through the portal grows stronger.
Hold off the fiends while you make final preparations.
As the rift shrinks and finally begins to close, a terrible creature claws its way through and leaps towards you.
Your goal is clear! The Twilight Grove must be found! But getting out of the fallen dragon's icy lair will be easier said than done!
The frost that covers these giant rats doesn't seem to slow them down. Watch out!
A goblin raiding party is looting this level -- and their cast-off goods will hem you in unless you clear them out!
Even as the goblins close to melee, diseased rats are drawn to the noise of your fight!
A giant centipede has laid claim to this hallway! You need to put this monster down quickly -- but these rats won't get out of your way!
Monstrous spiders of all kinds call these web-strewn hallways home -- and they don't appear too keen on welcoming visitors!
As fast as you drive these arachnids away, more of them scuttle in from the darkness!
Confining webs are closing in around you! Clear them out before you're trapped!
Two more packs of spiders press in! You're surrounded!
A skull-face spider looms at the center of this arachnid horde! Take this monster down!
As you push through spider territory, a final force of monstrous arachnids pursues you to the bitter end!
As you drive the giant spiders back, a hunting pack of wolf spiders appears behind you! It's an ambush!
These slime-covered goblins mean to slow you down, but you have no time to lose! Disarming these foes might make them reconsider this fight.
The faster you move, the harder the goblins pursue!
A deadly gelatinous cube is the source of all this slime. Take this ooze to the cleaners!
These diseased giant rats have been surviving on the dungeon's abandoned stores -- but they seem suddenly keen on fresh meat!
A second wave of rats hits you hard! Stand fast!
This goblin raiding party seems intent on setting up a watchpost here. Clearing out their supplies will send them packing!
Goblin reinforcements press in from all sides! Look sharp!
The goblin scout who leads these raiders rallies their troops for a last stand! Hit them hard!
Rats drawn to the sounds of combat are looking to pick off survivors. Send these rodents on their way!
As fast as you scatter them, more diseased rats press in!
These bugbears seem to have issue with you wanting to harvest the roots of their grove. Time for some delicate negotiations while you collect!
The alarm is sounded! More bugbears join the fray!
You have the bugbears on the run -- but a monstrous dire wolf shores up their counterattack!
It appears that you're not the only ones seeking the magic of the grove. You need to deal with these bandits before they can interfere with your plans!
As fast as you drive them back, the tenacious bandits quickly regroup!
A full squad of bandit wizards steps up to enter the fight! Depriving them of their stylish garb might rattle them!
The wizards fall back! But a force of bandit warriors sets up a new defensive line!
The captain and the wizard who lead this gang seem to have a lot on their mind. Give them some quality time -- far away from you!
Your route through the dungeon has led you to the heart of the goblin residential district! Watch yourselves!
Though many of the goblins seem anxious to let you pass, a number of malcontents are intent on proving their bravery against you. Push them back!
The darkness of these halls works to the goblins' advantage in a fight. Grab up this glowing fungi to light your way!
As fast as you push through them, the goblins regroup! Keep moving!
This goblin warleader seems intent on proving his mettle against you. Try to let him and his troops down easy!
A familiar stench tells you you're entering rat territory. Be on your guard!
As hard as you try to push through them, these diseased rats are relentless in their counterassault!
The rats fight from spite as much as from hunger. Collecting a few of their tails as trophies might shake their resolve!
These halls grow ever filthier as you advance. Watch your step!
A bloodthirsty rat is the alpha of this diseased pack! Take this monstrous rodent down!
This goblin scout party wasn't expecting you -- but they've got powerful backup close at hand!
These hobgoblins are fierce fighters -- and the twig blights swarming at the edge of the fray make for an even more lethal threat!
The hobgoblins have the advantage of numbers. Disarming them might be the only way to slow them down!
Your assault has the hobgoblins wavering, finally -- but goblin reinforcements quickly fill in the line!
This hobgoblin priest tries to inspire its followers for a frenzied final assault!
Twig blights from the Twilight Grove home in on you, as a force of goblin defenders does its best to lock down these halls!
As fast as you clear them out, more goblins and twig blights press in!
The goblins fall back at last -- but only to get their archers into position beyond impenetrable briars! Clear this unnatural ground cover out!
Goblin warriors press in while others continue to pepper you from range -- and all the while, the twig blights swarm!
Durnn talks a good game. Too bad for him that you didn't come to talk!
Breaking out of these drow thrall pens is going to take some kind of distraction. And what better distraction that a good old-fashioned prison brawl!
The cursed rats have retreated, but a cluster of giant spiders is drawn in to the sound of your fight!
There's no telling when you'll eat next during this breakout, so you'd best grab a meal for later while you can!
The drow guards respond to the out-of-control brawl at last. Bring them on!
It's a prison break! But a swarm of giant spiders and a ravenous black pudding are blocking the exit from the pens!
Your escape route is plain to see, but a force of cursed rats and quaggoth guards is hot on your trail!
A drow patrol tries to take over this arena. Send these warriors on their way!
The guards break, but as fast as you drive the quaggoths off, still more force their way toward you. Scattering the remains of their foul meals might distract them!
Quaggoths and cursed rats press in on all sides of you! Stand fast!
An enlarged duergar leads a final assault by the prisoners meant to break you! You need to finish this boss if you mean to escape!
These cursed rats are the only things standing between you and the next tunnel. Move quickly now!
The road to freedom gets ever longer, as your escape route leads you through another area of thrall pens -- and these prisoners don't seem keen on clearing a path for you!
A mass of giant spiders is swarming in search of food. Clear out these discarded ration containers to force them to scavenge elsewhere!
Your attempted escape has thrown all the cells into chaos! And you're caught in the middle of it!
A monstrous tarantula arrives to take charge of its scavenging spiders -- and quickly sets them on the hunt!
Crashing through prison pens brings you into a brawl between prisoners and quaggoth guards! Keep moving!
The members of a drow patrol join their quaggoth servants to set up a three-front fight!
You're halfway through the pens! But another wave of cursed rats comes hurtling out of the darkness! Clip these creatures' tails to make them rethink this fight!
A last mob of prisoners is the only thing between you and freedom -- but most have no intention of joining your escape!
The quaggoths are back! And a deadly quaggoth thonot leads their assault!
Vrocks on the wing! You're past the prison pens at last, but are caught up in the middle of a sudden demonic assault!
The drow who were fighting the vrocks fall back -- content to let you take on these fiends by yourselves!
Whatever reason these vrocks have for seizing these strange flowers is enough reason to try to stop them! Grab them up while you can!
Pushing past the vrocks gets you farther away from the drow -- but a wandering patrol tries to force you back!
A chasme demon attempts to reform the ranks of its vrock kin! Hit all these fiends hard!
The drow are out in force to try to drive you back to your prison. Hit them hard!
Another force of drow guards presses in. And these cursed rats refuse to give up the fight!
Drow rangers have set up an ambush point behind a wall of fungus. Push through!
The furious rangers set themselves up to take you down -- but you'll need to clear your way through these fighters to deal with them!
This drow dungeon warden tries to regroup the last of their forces. Hit them hard!
A party of drow cultists is attempting to hold these tunnels against you. Push through!
As the cultists fall back, a fighter patrol pushes in! It's an ambush!
Extra ropes used in the building of this bridge will be invaluable in the Underdark. Grab them all!
Hanging on to this rope bridge is tricky enough -- and the pursuit of the drow isn't making it any easier!
This hook horror has homed in on the sounds of combat -- even as a pack of cursed rats swarms out of the darkness!
You've crossed the bridge, but drow fighters are in hot pursuit. Keep moving!
Every way you turn, more drow emerge from the darkness!
This chitine pack guards a drow rations cache. Stock up while you can!
As the chitine swarm after you, a patrol of drow cultists presses in!
Focusing the fight on you, a drow house captain leads the cultists and their chitine servants in a deadly assault!
The drow are out in full force against you -- just as another mob of demons erupts from the darkness!
The vrocks scatter, but a mischief of cursed rats make a last-gasp assault!
Your escape route leads you into spider territory -- and you'll end up stuck here unless you clear these webs out!
The shrieking of these spiders brings drow fighters on the run!
As the drow fighters flee, their vengeful house captain commands the spiders to make a final assault!
You're almost at the edge of Velkynvelve and into the open Underdark! But these cursed rats refuse to give up the chase!
The rats are slowing down -- but a force of drow fighters tries to cut off your escape!
A veritable wall of drow holds the bridge against you. Disarming some of these warriors might be your only chance!
Halfway across the bridge, a force of drow cultists joins the fight! Keep moving!
Ilvara regroups her forces for a final battle! Take this priestess down or all is lost!

sequence.text: Something must have made the farmer go mad. Let's investigate the area.
Vultures. Blech. These winged scavengers don't deserve our pity.
There was more to that farmer than met the eye.
Indeed. How could he have afforded such a powerful warhorse?
None of this really explains it. Let's keep searching the property. We must be missing something.
Did you hear that?
There's something in there...
Sllfp... Treasure... Below...
sequence.name: Cursed Farmhand

sequence.text: What's that? Treasure below?
Zppflt! Sfvveik!
sequence.name: Cursed Farmhand

sequence.text: He said 'treasure below...' look for a trap door or a hidden stairway.
I think I found something!
A secret tunnel. How cliché.
This is quite the treasure. No wonder the farmer had such wealth. But where did it come from, and is it the cause of the curse?
There's more light ahead. Perhaps another end of this tunnel?
Incredible. A hidden dungeon. This may be where the farmer's treasure came from.
Let's be careful. This curse is no joke.
These gnolls don't seem to be cursed. Perhaps we're on the wrong track?
Maybe the curse takes time to fester. It looks like these gnolls have not been here very long.
A treasure room! Now we're talking!
Be careful. We still don't know if any of this stuff is cursed.
I have a bad feeling about this.
One of these papers looks like a map. If I'm right, there's a whole second level of the dungeon below us. There must be stairs somewhere.
Do you guys notice how clean it is down here? There's barely any dust or grime.
Whoa! This stuff is really valuable! Who would just leave it all down here?
I recognize those symbols. They're of Talona, the Mistress of Disease. That's not good.
It looks like someone has been living down here.
Judging by the imps, I'd say they're up to no good.
Hopefully they're not too cursed to tell us what's going on.
Many of these books seem to deal with Talona. It wouldn't surprise me if she's involved with the curse somehow.
Look here. Another hidden tunnel.
Look! The cauldron is cracked! It's leaking into the ground. I'm betting it's getting into the ground water and causing the curse.
Nobody touch it! Celeste, can we neutralize it?
I think so. We just need some basic materials.
What are you people doing? Leave that alone! You'll ruin everything!
sequence.name: Cleric

sequence.text: Your cauldron is causing trouble above. It must be neutralized.
No! No I won't let you! Talona! Aid me!
sequence.name: Cleric

sequence.text: New plan: We've got to close that rift!
I can do it! I just need to paint the right warding symbol!
Okay! This should cause the rift to close! Just hold them off for a few more seconds!
Phew! That should do it. This area won't be safe for a while, though. The poison has permeated the groundwater and poisoned the land.
We'll post signs on our way out.
At least the treasure is curse-free. Right?

We need to get moving. There's no telling what lies between us and the Twilight Grove -- or what we'll find when we get there. Erky, you were speaking of other prisoners who were captured with you. You think they were sent to the grove?

More than sure. Three adventurers, they were. Came to the Sunless Citadel on the same mission as you -- to discover the source of those evil apples. Some hobgoblin chief took them. The goblins said he worked for the dark druid, Belak the Outcast. It was Belak who wanted the prisoners, and alive.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Right. Let's get loaded and ready, then. Looks like we got some dungeon sloggin' ta do, but with that Meepo as a guide, we should make good time.
No! Meepo not go. Meepo heartbroken, and must grieve loss of beautiful Calcryx. No more adventures for Meepo. No more...
sequence.name: Meepo

sequence.text: Oi. I can get as choked up as tha next dwarf about losin' a lovin' pet, but that dragon hated ye! She woulda killed ye if we hadn't stepped in.
Meepo and Calcryx had... complicated relationship...
sequence.name: Meepo

sequence.text: Sorry to interrupt, but that shrieking sound getting closer has me a bit on edge...
Well, that kobold's scarpered, sure 'nuff. So much fer a guide.
We'll make do, Bruenor. We have enough trackers in the group, and plenty of tracks to follow.
Too many tracks, Celeste. Is chaos, this ground. But Minsc and Boo will persevere!
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: That's the last of the goblins fled. Erky, will following them lead us to the grove?
That's a strong maybe, but I'm afraid I don't know. Some of the goblins work for Belak, but most of those ruffians are out only for themselves.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Tracking the fruit they were selling is of paramount importance. We can't allow any more of those cursed apples to reach the surface world.
Aye. While I was imprisoned, it was the winter apple I heard them speak of. The white apple of death. It was said to be nearly ready.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Then it sounds like we got some fruit pickin' ta do. Come on.
Tracks continue this way. Definitely the clear path through here.
I think we might need to discuss a basic definition of 'clear.' Those webs ahead are so thick I can't even see through them.
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: But is perfect that way. Maximum obscuring means foes cannot see us as we approach. Come! Follow Minsc, all!
Oh, this is going to be a very long trip...
Finally, we're clear of that web-infested ruin. I don't think I'll ever get these clothes clean. But I can see clearer hallways ahead.
You'd be better to keep an eye out behind. The spiders are hot on our trail. We need to move!
Them spiders is breakin' finally. Elf, can ye see 'em goin'?
Yes, they're back to their own territory. Now we just need to worry about what's ahead of us.
Minsc has good guess on that. Look! Goblin tracks are here.
Those are halfling tracks, actually. My tracks, in fact. I'm standing right here.
Sorry. Look! Goblin tracks are over there.
Oh, lovely. But you're right, those are goblin footprints... and there's something off about them. What is that? Slime?
Feh. Ye wanna be careful touchin' that stuff, even wearin' gloves, elf.
No worries, Bruenor. They're your gloves. And you can take them back because you're going to need them! Slime-covered goblins moving in!
We got 'em on tha run! Now form up on me and hit these slimy blighters hard!
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: What is ahead? Is nothing there to threaten about, Boo. You are worry-hamster, I tell you.
I normally like to never take the side of rodents during an argument, but hold up. I think Boo's spotted something... something glistening...
Lotta muck on top o' these here dungeon stones, but me dwarf senses is tellin' me we're goin' in circles. Minsc, are ye sure ye got us on tha right track?
Minsc is confident. Tracks lead on this way. Four toes, sharp claws. Clearly rat.
I thought you were following the goblins' tracks?
We follow goblin tracks, and Minsc sees where goblins take off hunting rats. Now follow rats to get back to goblins. Try to keep up, drow. We have no time to waste!
Looks like Minsc was right. There's goblins dead ahead!
That's not a scouting party. They're hunkered down, waiting for an assault.
Well, good thing they got one comin', then. Everyone ta me! Then charge!
The goblins are breaking. The main force is headed toward that hall straight ahead.
Then let's stay on 'em. 'Tis a safe bet that even if they ain't goin' ta tha Twilight Grove, they're lookin' ta report ta someone who will be. Come on!

The dark magic in the ground here is growing almost tangible as we get closer to the Gulthias Tree. These sickly roots... I'd like to get samples of these for study. They might grant insight into how to destroy the tree when we find it.
You'll need to collect quickly, I'm afraid. Trouble ahead! Well, more trouble than normal, I mean. I can see a bugbear squad moving in.
Bugbears! We are getting close to the grove. The goblins talked about the bugbears who took over their clan being in league with Belak.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Then let's give Celeste a hand while we get up close and personal with these blighters. We got business with their boss, and time's a-wastin'!
Them bugbears is boltin'. So followin' them should lead right ta where we wanna be.
Hold up! There's someone else ahead, coming down that side passage.
Look sharp there! Another company ahead. Mercenary adventurers by their look. You rabble! Clear yourselves out and back to the surface. This dungeon has been claimed by the Black Rock Gang.
sequence.name: Bandit Captain

sequence.text: I know that name. Bandits and reprobates, every one of you. What's your business here?
Wouldn't you like to know, knight? We're not here for the goblins' magic apples, that's for sure.
sequence.name: Bandit Wizard

sequence.text: What are... you just told them we're here for the apples! Now they'll want them too.
sequence.name: Bandit Captain

sequence.text: No, I said we weren't here for the apples. That's called 'bluffing.' Don't you know anything? How you ever got to run this gang is beyond me.
sequence.name: Bandit Wizard

sequence.text: Well, this is entertaining, but we're on a schedule. Everyone to me! Then clear these brigands out!
There's too many of them! We need to break off!
sequence.name: Bandit Wizard

sequence.text: What's that, more bluffing? So subtle. I'm sure they'll fall for it this time.
sequence.name: Bandit Captain

sequence.text: You're always like this, every time we do a raid. I get nothing but criticism from you!
sequence.name: Bandit Wizard

sequence.text: Oh, that's rich. You ever listen to yourself? Every order I give, there you are with, 'Are you sure you want to do that?'
sequence.name: Bandit Captain

sequence.text: I ain't got no idea what's goin' on with these two, but I'm thinkin' we need ta put an end ta this. Everybody line up! Then get these ruffians headin' fer tha doors!
That bandit set-to cost us time. But the goblin tracks are still thick on the ground here.
There's light comin' from ahead. And voices. Lots and lots o' voices...
There are so many of them fleeing from us. This place is in a state of pandemonium.
Most of these are just villagers, not fighters. If we give them space, they'll hopefully clear out on their own.
Be good if that works fer most o' them. But in me experience with goblins, there's always some o' them got somethin' ta prove...
Hold, interlopers! You think you can attack the heart of goblin territory and just walk away.
sequence.name: Goblin Warleader

sequence.text: We're trying to run away, curse you! We have no quarrel with you, but you keep throwing yourselves in our way and attacking!

Typical surface-worlder. Too cowardly to fight, too brazen to ever give up. Well, now you're in a ring of goblin steel and we'll see how you like it. Then we'll deliver you all to Durnn and you'll get what you deserve.
sequence.name: Goblin Warleader

sequence.text: Durnn! That was the hobgoblin chief. The one who took the prisoners away.
sequence.name: Erky Timbers

sequence.text: Then it sounds like we got our own meetin' set up with that chief already. But we gotta clear these goblins out first. Come on!
Ye're sure them goblins ain't followin' us?
No sign of them. Either we scared them off or they're confident this Durnn will take care of us.
Hopefully word gets to him that we're on our way. If we're lucky, he'll come to us and we can end this search.
Still feel like we're side-trackin' too much. These halls is a maze. Best be on guard fer whatever lies ahead.
Good news, I can see what look like rat-free hallways ahead. Bad news, we need to get through that mob ahead to reach them.
Monster rat! Hungry rat! Doom!
Feh. We got this far through these rodents and ain't no worse fer wear. Time ta push through tha last o' them and be done with it. Let's go!
That was a tougher fight than it had any right ta be. These goblinoids is better trained than some o' them we fought before.
If this is the home territory of this Durnn, these are likely his best defenders. We've got a fight on our hands, I think.
Watch out! Deekin scout ahead and see shouty magic hobgoblin! Very dangerous!
Pretty sure that means there's some kind of spellcaster leading this group. Yes, just there.
Surface-worlders! You dare trespass onto the territory of the Durbuluk tribe? You will all of you die!
sequence.name: Hobgoblin Priest

sequence.text: No one's ever happy to see us. So disheartening.
Listen while you can, priest. We have business with your chief, Durnn. And with the evil you serve in the Twilight Grove. But you can make this easy on yourselves if you wish. Stand down.
Insolence! The Durbuluk do not stand down to the likes of you. This citadel is ours! And I will make offerings to Maglubiyet of your hearts when this is done!
sequence.name: Hobgoblin Priest

sequence.text: There's a wall of goblinoids to all sides of us. And they're ready to fight.
Looks like ye was right, Nayeli. We sent a message earlier that's got that Durnn comin' ta us.
Stay close, everyone. Keep an eye out for the prisoners. There's no turning back now.
Fools. You think you can stand against the might of the Durbuluk?
sequence.name: Durnn

sequence.text: Durnn, we would be happy to stand with the Durbuluk if you cease these hostilities. There's a greater evil here than you realize. If you help us destroy the Gulthias Tree and deal with Belak the Outcast, we might still make a peaceful solution to all this.

Your words are as hollow as your threat, cleric. I heard that same pleading from the adventurers who preceded you down here. Though the loudest of them quieted when I killed him. And the other two... well, they won't be saying much now.
sequence.name: Durnn

sequence.text: Don't waste your time, Celeste. This one's evil, through and through. But those who follow him might have a change of heart once they see their master fall!

That's tha last o' them goblinoids scatterin'. Could tell that a lot o' them dinna have their hearts in this fight. Safe bet that this Durnn took over by force and bloodshed. And even goblins get tired o' that sooner or later.
Friends! Minsc and Boo take point, scout ahead. Strange halls there are below us. Dark magic there.
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: It's the Twilight Grove. I can feel its evil even from here.
Durnn spoke of murdering one of the prisoners. Was he just boasting, do you think?
It's hard to say. But we'll find out soon enough. Get ready, my friends. The Gulthias Tree is beneath us -- and must be destroyed for the sake of all.
Squeak?
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: Ohhhh... Boo, why do you wake me? Minsc does not feel well. Is a good day to return to sleep again. Call again in several hours, please.
No time for sleeping in, Minsc. You've just regained consciousness. You need to stay awake to clear your head. Come on now.
How's everyone else doing?
Lots of bruises, but no serious injuries, thankfully. Well, assuming we can keep Jarlaxle away from Izhkin.
That conniving derro brought an entire cavern down on our heads! The pleats on this cloak are ruined. Five minutes with him and a thin blade. That's all I ask.
Not to interrupt most excellent rant, but where are we? There is surprising number of surly strangers and cursed-looking rats lingering in shadows all around.

Some kind o' drow prison pens. Gotta be hunnerds o' thralls down here. But we ain't stayin'. Everybody! Minsc was tha last one ta wake. Ye all know tha plan. We're gonna get tha drow's attention, then get outta here. Time ta get our riot on! Let's go!
I'm surprised how many of these prisoners are joining the riot on the other side. A lot of them are already loyal to the drow.
Take it easy on 'em, then. We just need ta make some noise that'll get tha drow down here and openin' up these cells ta see what's goin' on.
Noise? I can help with that. Now where'd my pack go...?
sequence.name: Izhkin

sequence.text: You've already helped quite enough, my derro friend. Now stay at the back and keep out of trouble, like we talked about.
I'm just saying, one well-placed charge along those bars. Take out those buttresses. Bring it all down. It'll be beautiful!
sequence.name: Izhkin

sequence.text: All right, give me three minutes with the derro. Just three. Celeste, please.
Everyone move in! Hold your lines. Get those gates open. Now show these rabble what kind of mistake they've made.
sequence.name: Drow Guard

sequence.text: Finally! Everybody keep yer eyes on them gates. Grab up anybody carryin' keys. We're walkin' outta here right now!
Outlander fool. The mistress described the arrogance of you Champions all too accurately.
sequence.name: Drow Guard

sequence.text: So that's who's claimed us? That drow priestess? Ow! Watch that whip!
You will speak of the mistress only when spoken to, Outlander! We will teach you respect!
sequence.name: Drow Guard

sequence.text: The guards have retreated! Quickly, to the gates!
Is all chaos here! More prisoners coming with us, more prisoners fighting back!
That's not the worst of it. The drow have monstrous defenses on the far side of the gates! Watch yourselves!
More rabble trying to make a nuisance of themselves. Send the quaggoths in!
sequence.name: Drow Dungeon Warden

sequence.text: Typical craven captain. Send in them that's expendable against a foe ye know ye can't beat.
Brave words, dwarf. That bravado will serve you well in the fighting pits... after you learn your place, of course.
sequence.name: Drow Dungeon Warden

sequence.text: Ignore their taunting. They've had more practice at it than you have. There, straight ahead! That open tunnel.
Everybody listen ta tha drow. Well, listen ta our drow and ignore tha rest. Let's go!
Blast it. Wrong turn.
We're in the fighting pits. Can we get through or do we need to turn back?
Through. There'll be another access passage beyond to match the one we followed here. If we move fast, we won't give them time to regroup.
Drow guards are comin' in strong ta back tha quaggoths up! Give 'em all ye got!
Minsc sees more prisoners coming in. And they are armed and unfriendly.
The drow don't want to fight us. It means they're taking our threat seriously, at least... wait. There's someone breaking off from the mob.
King Bruenor! It is you! I thought I recognized you. I told them I'd fight just to see if I could get close.
sequence.name: Eldeth

sequence.text: Listen, lass, it's been a right many years since anyone called me king, and I got no need fer it today. Bruenor's good 'nuff. But ye're welcome ta fight alongside us if ye like.
I'll fight with you to the bitter end, my... Bruenor. Let me stand beside you. Here they come!
sequence.name: Eldeth

sequence.text: With the duergar down, the prisoners are scattering. Let's move!
That was an honor fightin' at yer side, young Eldeth. But how long have ye been here? And what can ye tell us o' this place? They way we arrived, we're a bit short o' useful lore.

I've not been here long, but I've learned what I can. I was on a long scouting mission from Gauntlgrym when the drow captured me. This is the outpost of Velkynvelve, controlled by Ilvara of House Mizzrym. Her forces are unswervingly loyal, and gathering more prisoners by the day.
sequence.name: Eldeth

sequence.text: Ilvara Mizzrym. She's the one Jorlan Duskryn warned us of. And I'm guessing now that she was our mystery priestess who fled the fight.
Jorlan Duskryn! That conniving snake. He's Ilvara's right hand. Or he was, at least, till he wasn't beautiful enough for her anymore. Shoor Vandree is her pet now.
sequence.name: Eldeth

sequence.text: I suspect we'll get to meet most of the major players before this is over. So let's try to set those meetings up quickly. Come on!
No! It's another thrall pen complex. They've made this place as unnavigable as possible.

Is the best way to prevent escape, no doubt. The drow, they build their tunnels in twisting ways, looping back on themselves. Long strands crossed by others. Radiating out from center. Reminding me of something...
A web, perhaps?
Yes! Was on tip of Minsc's tongue.
Squeak!
sequence.name: Boo

sequence.text: Less reflectin' and more directin', elf. Which way are we goin'?
Straight through the hard way. Come on!
Drow patrol coming in behind us!
They'll have ta bash their way through this crowd o' prisoners and spiders ta reach us. Good luck with that.
There they are! Take the Champions down, on the mistress's command. Kill anyone who gets in your way!
sequence.name: Drow Dungeon Warden

sequence.text: The number of prisoners here is astonishing. What can this Ilvara be planning to do with them all?
If we can get outta here and keep tha gates sprung, hopefully these folks won't have ta find out. There's 'nuff o' them, they should be able ta make it back up ta tha caverns where Izhkin was set up.
No! All my smokepowder stores...
sequence.name: Izhkin

sequence.text: Will be better in literally anyone's hands than yours, I'm afraid. Izhkin, stay back, as you've been told. You can't hold your own in this combat.
So you say. No one ever listens!
sequence.name: Izhkin

sequence.text: The ranks of the prisoners are thinning out. Are the guards clearing them so quickly?
No... I think we're close to the end. The real end, this time. These must be the overflow cells. We're at the edge of the thrall pens!
We gonna get out this time, ye think? Or is this more o' tha drow tunnelin' back on themselves?
Only one way to find out...
The gates! There! We'll hold the last of the quaggoths back! The rest of you go!
On it, elf! Everybody with a heavy weapon, hit them chains!
Fools! Chains are forged. Chains are strong. There! The hinge pins. Hit them now! Hit them!
sequence.name: Izhkin

sequence.text: By me gran's squeaky privy door, ye done it, ye mad derro! Keep them gates open now! Everybody move!
Ain't never been so glad ta break outa a dank cave tunnel inta... well, okay, it's another dank cave tunnel. But this one's leadin' out!
Eventually, yes. We've got a lot of outpost to cover before then, though. And a lot of drow zealots looking to impress the mistress. And a lot of other prisoners coming with us, apparently...
Lead on, Champions! Ilvara boasted that she had you caught, but we knew she couldn't hold you. Oh, but where are my manners? Buppido, at your service.
sequence.name: Buppido

sequence.text: Our reputation precedes us, apparently. All of you, you'll need to stay close and move fast. But you're all getting out of here today. Ilvara claimed to know the Champions, did she? Then let's remind her followers what we stand for.
Listen! What is shrieking sound from ahead?
The drow running in fear, ideally. But I doubt we're going to be that lucky...
Well, them drow has fallen off in a hurry, but I reckon they'll be back.
This makes no sense. What are demons doing in the Underdark in such numbers?
I have no idea. And I'm expecting any moment for you to say...
This threat is bigger than we'd thought. This isn't just the drow alone with access to the surface world through Velkynvelve. We need to know what's going on here.
Called it. Hey... there's some kind of stand of glowing flowers ahead. Strange... they're not an Underdark feature I know.
The vrocks seem to recognize them, though. Come on!
All that vrock flapping. Do I hear buzzing sound too?
You do. Giant demon fly coming in fast! I'm a good spotter, Champions. I'm at your service.
sequence.name: Buppido

sequence.text: That's a chasme! It must be directing this vrock pack somehow.
Them vrocks is only manageable when they're flyin' erratic, so we can't afford ta let 'em get organized. If this new fiend's in charge, then it's gotta go!
There are signs of demon ichor all across Velkynvelve. We need to follow it. See where they're coming from.
There they are! Get into position, double march!
sequence.name: Drow Dungeon Warden

sequence.text: It looks like our friend is back.
I know that one. He's all talk and no traction. If we can give him a good push, he'll run out of steam.
sequence.name: Eldeth

sequence.text: Then let's get ta steamin' ourselves. Everybody move!
Curse you all! You've cost me favor in the mistress's eyes. I'll see you all back in the thrall cages for this, and when you die in the fighting pits, my face will be the last thing you see!
sequence.name: Drow Dungeon Warden

sequence.text: You talk a good game, drow. And you've had enough chances to stand down. If you want a fight to the finish, you'll get it. Or you can take the message back to your mistress that she doesn't know the Champions nearly as well as she thinks.
Not a pleasant end for him, but it was the one he deserved.
sequence.name: Eldeth

sequence.text: Too much o' that hatin' madness down here in tha Underdark, ye ask me. Bein' away from light and sky too long, it changes folk. And not fer tha good.
Indeed. I've seen it myself. A lot of derro go mad, they say.
sequence.name: Izhkin

sequence.text: Do tell. And by that, I mean please don't tell. Keep moving, everyone.
Rope bridge ahead! We're gonna bottleneck bad with all these prisoners behind us. Nothin' fer it, though. Everybody get movin' across, quick as ye can!
Nonsense! I know a way around this conundrum, easy peasy.
sequence.name: Buppido

sequence.text: What, like a shortcut? If ye can help us, derro, we're all ears.
It's a classic problem, easily solved. Too many people crossing the bridge? Just throw half of them over. Fewer Champions, quicker exit strategy.
sequence.name: Buppido

sequence.text: ... Not quite sure I'm followin' ye there, friend...
It's all right, Bruenor. I think he just needs a bit of light and sky. Buppido, you'd better walk with me.
Almost across... ah, no. There's a scraping sound I know too well.
Hook horror! And it's hittin' tha bridge full speed!
Look! Something else moving along bridge ropes! Everything is shaking!
Everybody push ta tha far side, fast as ye can! And hang on!
The drow are falling back finally. I think we might have them on the run!
I suspect they weren't falling back as much as giving their reinforcements room to move in. You hear that scrabbling sound? That's chitines getting ready for a brawl. Watch yourselves!
These cultists are relentless. We're getting boxed in here!
That's it! Force them back to the walls! Hold them there!
sequence.name: Drow House Captain

sequence.text: Oh, thank you. Just when I needed something to focus on, there's another drow commander with delusions of grandeur. Will you stand, braggart? Or does your bravery only show when you've got a force of guards between you and danger?
Listen... is shrieking sound again. Vrocks are back!
And look! They're emerging from that tunnel there. And that's not the same pack we fought before. There's not a scratch on these ones.
Are ye thinkin' there's some kind o' abyssal gate down that way? Someone summonin' these fiends, maybe?
I don't know. But if we can get clear of Velkynvelve at last, we'll have a chance to find out.
On me! On me, you cravens! Get back here!
sequence.name: Drow House Captain

sequence.text: It looks like the fighters have finally figured out this isn't a fight they can win. It's a pity their captain isn't as wise.
Insolent cur. Surface-world traitor!
sequence.name: Drow House Captain

sequence.text: Sticks and stones, friend. I'm sure you were planning on playing a big part in whatever plans your Ilvara has for Velkynvelve. But every warrior like you eventually learns that to a leader like her, everyone is expendable.
I think I can see... yes! Another rope bridge ahead. And then open cavern beyond!
I see it too! If we make it across, we'll have left Velkynvelve behind.
sequence.name: Buppido

sequence.text: And if we make short work o' these last drow, hopefully it'll keep down tha number o' huntin' parties comin' after us. But I wish we had some idea where we're goin' after that. Chasin' demons is one thing, but we're gonna need respite sooner than later.
Bruenor, I think I might be able to help. This is Shuushar the Awakened. He and I met in the thrall pens. He's been helping the wounded prisoners keep moving.
sequence.name: Eldeth

sequence.text: A kuo-toa! It's a rare thing to meet one of your folk, Shuushar.
Yes. This is not my place. Not my people. All this fighting pains me. Creatures taking arms against each other. But I understand why it must be done.
sequence.name: Shuushar

sequence.text: Maybe best ye do yer understandin' from tha back o' tha ranks, friend. And watch yerself, Eldeth! We got trouble comin' in!
The rats are regrouping. We need to move quickly. Shuushar, what did Eldeth mean when she said you might be able to help us?
If I am fortunate enough to escape this place, I know where you may rest, Champions. A safe place. My settlement, Sloobludop.
sequence.name: Shuushar

sequence.text: Um... we're going to a kuo-toa settlement? Not a lot of light and sky there. If you know what I mean?
I don't think we have much of a choice, Jarlaxle. Bruenor's right, we need respite. Shuushar, we appreciate your offer, and we will follow you. But we need to get across that bridge first. Come on!
Here's the bridge! You first, friend!
sequence.name: Buppido

sequence.text: I don't need you holding my hand, Buppido. Wait... what...?
I know what. Watch out!
sequence.name: Izhkin

sequence.text: You! Get away from me...! Aiiieeee...!!!!
sequence.name: Buppido

sequence.text: Oi! Izhkin, ye mad derro! Ye just pushed yer kin over tha edge o' tha cliff! Ye've killed him...! And made him drop that... poisoned dagger...?
Which he was going to stab me with. This is an interesting turn of events. But we don't have time to break it down quite yet. Come on!

Champions! I see I return to Velkynvelve just in time. You've given my forces a fine chase, but the chase is done. Your new mistress stands before you. You have nowhere to go but back to the cages that are your homes now.
sequence.name: Ilvara

sequence.text: If you think your words carry any more weight than those of your lackeys we dispensed with, think again, priestess. Your reign ends today. Whatever plans you had for the Lurkwood are finished.

Ha! My plans for the Lurkwood? My plan was to lure all of you here, fool. All your reputation for doing good. Saving every hamlet and farmer's hovel that comes under threat, because that's what the Champions do.
sequence.name: Ilvara

sequence.text: I know this might not be the most opportune time, but she does have a point...
I knew that attacks on the worthless settlers in the wood would draw you forth and into my trap. But thanks to your derro friend, the trap didn't even need to be set!
sequence.name: Ilvara

sequence.text: I'm sorry, I was kind o' takin' a moment there. Are ye still talkin', drow? 'Cause I'm done listenin'. I'm glad yer trap got sprung early, so no folk o' tha Lurkwood came ta harm from ye. And now I'm gonna make sure ye don't hurt no folk anywhere, anymore.
That's tha last we're gonna see o' that Ilvara. Though I got no doubt that whatever treachery she's set up has still got threads danglin'. Is everybody over tha bridge? Is that all o' tha prisoners?
That's everyone. Including our unexpected hero.
Indeed. That's a potent poison on that blade of Buppido's. Izhkin, I may owe you an apology.
Of course you do. Couldn't see a crazed derro standing right in front of you. No one ever sees!
sequence.name: Izhkin

sequence.text: Yes, that's definitely a 'may owe you.' I'll have to reserve judgment.
I mean, what was he thinking, stealing my plan?!
sequence.name: Izhkin

sequence.text: ... I'm sorry, what now?

Elf, ye're gonna need ta sort this later. Right now, we need ye and Minsc scoutin' a route ahead fer us. We gotta get ta a place we can rest. And then we gotta figure out whereabouts these demons is flockin' in tha Underdark... and why...

reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Torm, the god of duty and loyalty, revered by those who face danger to bring about a greater good.

reset_currency_defines.name: Kelemvor's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Kelemvor, the lord of the dead, the judge of the damned, who despises the undead and seeks a peaceful transition for all.

reset_currency_defines.name: Leira's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Leira, the goddess of deception and illusions, who delights in the confusion sown by her various incarnations.

reset_currency_defines.name: Jergal's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Jergal, the final scribe, the pitiless one, the bleak seneschal, who abdicated control of the dead to three ambitious mortals.

reset_currency_defines.name: Shar's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Shar, the Mistress of the Night, the Dark Lady, Our Lady of Loss. The dark twin of Selune.

reset_currency_defines.name: Oghma's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Oghma, god of inspiration, invention, and knowledge. Their faithful spread knowledge and literacy far and wide.

reset_currency_defines.name: Eldath's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Eldath, a goddess of peace. Her presence is felt whereever there is calm.

reset_currency_defines.name: Sune's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Sune, the Lady of Love, the Princess of Passion. She is a deity of passion and delights of the senses.

reset_currency_defines.name: Umberlee's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Umberlee, the Bitch Queen, the Queen of the Depths, the Wavemother. Umberlee is feared by sailors and their loved ones alike.

reset_currency_defines.name: Lliira's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Lliira, Our Lady of Joy, Joybringer, Mistress of Revels. The beloved goddess of contentment, release, joy, happiness, dance, and freedom.

reset_currency_defines.name: Lathander's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Lathander, the god of spring, birth, and renewal. He is a god not of the sun, but of dawn, representing a new day full of promise.

reset_currency_defines.name: Rillifane's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Rillifane Rallathil, the elven deity of seasons.

reset_currency_defines.name: Helm's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Helm, god of watchfulness.

reset_currency_defines.name: Mystra's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Mystra, the goddess of magic and possibilities.

reset_currency_defines.name: Tiamat's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Tiamat, the five-headed goddess of greed.

reset_currency_defines.name: Auril's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Auril, the Frostmaiden, the merciless goddess of cold and winter. Folk worship Auril to seek mercy from a hard winter.

reset_currency_defines.name: Bahamut's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Bahamut, eternal rival of Tiamat, his sister, and dragon god of justice.

reset_currency_defines.name: Corellon's Favor
reset_currency_defines.description: Favor with Corellon Larethian, Creator of the Elves.
